Explanation: The bug in the buggy code is that it starts repeating the last n characters from the wrong index. It should start from str.length()-n, but it starts from str.length()-n+1. This is because the substring method in Java starts from the given index till the end of the string. So, if we want to get the last n characters, we should start from str.length()-n. Generated Test cases 1-10 (10/11) should pass the buggy code, and all test cases should pass the perfect code.
